oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Trapping Dimethyltin Cations by Bipyridine-N,N '-Dioxide Ligands
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHANDRASEKHAR, V
SINGH, P
GOPAL, K
STEINER, A
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dimethyltin
Organotin cations
Cationic polymers
Hydrolysis
HYDRATED ORGANOTIN CATIONS
RAY CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE
AQUEOUS-SOLUTION
STRUCTURAL-CHARACTERIZATION
COMPLEX-FORMATION
1ST EXAMPLE
HYDROLYSIS
ACIDS
PHEN=1,10-PHENANTHROLINE
THERMODYNAMICS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: N,N'-dioxide ligands such as 2, 2'-bipyridine-N,N-dioxide (BPDO-I) and 4, 4'-bipyridine-N,N-dioxide (BPDO-II) were used to trap the hydrated dimethyltin cations under controlled hydrolysis. The use of the chelating ligand BPDO-I leads to the isolation of the discrete monocation [Me2Sn(BPDO-I)(OH2)(NO3)]+[NO3] (2), whereas the linear ligand BPDO-II directs the construction of cationic polymers, [{Me2Sn(OH2)2(mu-BPDO-II)}2+{NO3}2 center dot 2H2O]n (3 center dot 2H2O) and [{Me2Sn(mu-OH)(BPDO-II)}22+{NO3}2 center dot H2O]n (4 center dot H2O) under different reaction conditions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: ZEITSCHRIFT FUR ANORGANISCHE UND ALLGEMEINE CHEMIE, 638(11)1716-1722
